intro: Kailarsenia godefroyana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its large, showy flowers that open at night. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically white or pale pink, emitting a sweet fragrance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Kailarsenia godefroyana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal blooming habit.
